summary: This document is a chain of emails from May 2021 between FBI personnel discussing the scheduling of an interview related to a 302 report (FBI interview summary) that references Leon Black. The emails coordinate logistics, including booking a conference room at 290 Broadway and communicating with an attorney named Jeanne.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Referenced as the subject of FBI 302 reports that are being discussed and shared among FBI personnel in preparation for an interview.

persons.name: Jeanne
persons.context: Identified as an attorney who was spoken to regarding the scheduling of an interview; she and her client are noted as being available on a specific Tuesday.

persons.name: C-20
persons.context: Mentioned as wanting to sit in on an interview but being too swamped to easily schedule a time.

connections.description: Jeanne is identified as an attorney involved in scheduling an interview related to an FBI 302 referencing Leon Black, implying a legal representation connection.

events.title: Email exchange regarding 302s on Leon Black
events.description: FBI personnel exchange emails attaching 302 reports that reference Leon Black and discuss scheduling an interview related to the matter.

events.title: Conference room reservation for interview
events.description: An FBI agent reserves a conference room at 290 Broadway for an upcoming interview, preferring it over their office space.

locations.context: Location of a conference room booked by the FBI for an interview, noted as having better space than their office.

keyFacts: FBI 302 reports (interview summaries) referencing financier Leon Black were being circulated among FBI New York Field Office personnel in May 2021.
The FBI was actively scheduling an in-person interview related to these reports, coordinating with an attorney named Jeanne.
The preferred location for the interview was a conference room at 290 Broadway, chosen over the FBI's own office space.
The email chain indicates an ongoing investigation or inquiry by the FBI's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Desk where Leon Black was a subject.
